meanings.definition: The outer limits or edge of an area
meanings.sent1: The peripheries of the forest were filled with tall trees.
meanings.sent2: We took a walk along the peripheries of the park.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel played near the peripheries, peeking out occasionally.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts often wandered to the peripheries of reality.
meanings.sent5: The peripheries of the city were dotted with small villages.

meanings.definition: The surrounding area or outskirts of a place
meanings.sent1: We explored the peripheries of the town and found a hidden gem.
meanings.sent2: Living on the peripheries of the city offers a quieter lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The peripheries of the garden were home to mischievous rabbits.
meanings.sent4: Her mind wandered to the peripheries of imagination, seeking inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The peripheries of the desert stretched endlessly into the horizon.

meanings.definition: The outer parts of a group or system
meanings.sent1: The peripheries of the organization were often overlooked.
meanings.sent2: Innovation can sometimes come from the peripheries of a company.
meanings.sent3: The peripheries of the team were filled with new recruits.
meanings.sent4: His ideas always came from the peripheries of conventional thinking.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the peripheries of the network revealed hidden vulnerabilities.
